s.text: Whenever I've dealt with him he has seemed an extremely reasonable fellow (he wrote a good piece for me at TNR on race in the ranks) but, like many military types, he just seems to lose it when it comes to the obvious fact that homosexuals have been happily murdering and killing in uniform for generations.

Whenever I've dealt with him he has seemed an extremely reasonable fellow (he wrote a good piece for me at TNR on race in the ranks) but, like many military types, he just seems to lose it when it comes to the obvious fact that homosexuals have been happily murdering and killing in uniform for generations.

Whenever I've dealt with him he has seemed an extremely reasonable fellow (he wrote a good piece for me at TNR on race in the ranks) but, like many military types, he just seems to lose it when it comes to the obvious fact that homosexuals have been happily murdering and killing in uniform for generations.
I thought the Primary Colors movie was unconvincingly crude--can anyone believe for a moment that George Stephanopoulos was ever deeply, morally conflicted about anything?
